s.name: Absorb Knowledge
entries: You lay your hand on a scroll, book, or other surface with writing on it and begin to absorb the message thereon into your mind directly, learning whatever the text had to offer. For every 10 pages, the duration increases by 1 second. (Example: A 600 page text would take 1 minute to fully learn its contents.)
While concentrating on this spell, you are considered {@condition blinded} as images of the absorbed knowledge race through your mind.
If the writing is in a language which you do not understand, the spell fails.

spell.name: Eminent Command
entries: You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on all of its subsequent turns, making the same save each time. The spell has no effect if the target is Undead or if it doesn't understand your language. If your command is directly harmful to it, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with advantage or obey the command. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Some typical commands and their Effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.
- Agree: The target agrees with whatever was last proposed and uses its turn to facilitate the agreement.
- Approach: The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.
- Cower: The target whimpers and trembles and ends its turn. It makes Dexterity saving throws with disadvantage until its next turn.
- Die: The target falls limp as if dead and then ends its turn.
- Disagree: The target disagrees with whatever was last proposed and uses its turn to prevent the proposal.
- Drop: The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.
- Flee: The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.
- Grovel: The target falls {@condition prone} and then ends its turn.

- Halt: The target doesn't move and takes no Actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.
- No: The target stops what it is doing and uses its turn to subvert whatever it was doing last.
- Silence: The target ceases all vocalization or other noisemaking and ends its turn.
- Sleep: The target lays down and attempts to fall asleep, ending its turn.
- Yes: The target stops what it was doing and uses its turn to facilitate what was affirmed.
- Yield: The target drops all equipment it is holding and kneels, ending its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 60 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion

m.text: a miniature portal carved from ivory, a small piece of polished marble, and a tiny silver spoon, each item worth at least 5 gp

entries: You conjure an extradimensional dwelling in range that lasts for the duration. You choose where its one entrance is located. The entrance shimmers faintly and is 5 feet wide and 10 feet tall. You and any creature you designate when you cast the spell can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as the portal remains open. You can open or close the portal if you are within 30 feet of it. While closed, the portal is {@condition invisible}.
Beyond the portal is a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

You can create any floor plan you like, but the space can't exceed 50 cubes, each cube being 10 feet on each side. The place is furnished and decorated as you choose. It contains sufficient food to serve a nine course banquet for up to 100 people.

A staff of 100 servants attends all who enter. You decide the visual appearance of these servants and their attire. They are completely obedient to your orders. Each servant can perform any task a normal human servant could perform, but they can't attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Thus the servants can fetch things, clean, mend, fold clothes, light fires, serve food, pour wine, and so on. The servants can go anywhere in the mansion but can't leave it.

Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from the mansion. When the spell ends, any creatures inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance.
Casting this spell with the same configurations on the same spot every day for a year makes it permanent.

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Multi-Purpose Room
entries: You snap your fingers and cause the furnishings of a room to disappear into a pocket dimension. The area of the room cannot be larger than 100 square feet by 10 feet tall, and constructs and plants within the room qualify as furnishings for the purposes of this spell.

You can cast this spell again to switch between previously stowed furnishings for the room. Also, when you can cast this on a room created by another spell, such as Galder's Tower or Mighty Fortress, you can use it to switch between possible furnishings for the room as if they were provided by that spell.
A {@spell Restore Portal|arcanomicon} spell can return any stowed furnishings as well if the caster knows of their contents.

If any small or larger creature is in the targeted room, the spell fails, and tiny creatures do not disappear with any stowed furnishings, but rather remain in the room. (Plants and constructs are excluded from this rule, as they qualify as furnishings.)

components.m: A tiny, hollow, onyx box or cube

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the room can be 100 square feet wider and 10 feet taller for each slot level beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Restore Portal
entries: You reopen a portal created by another spell. You must have a good idea of what spell was cast and the perameters of that spell or the spell fails. If successfully cast, the portal reopens exactly as if it was just cast in the same way, with all parameters unchanged.
(Can be cast from either side of the portal, including from within a {@spell demiplane}.)

spell.name: Aeduct's Binding
entries: You mystically bind two objects in contact with eachother together. This can be food, furniture, etcetera. For the duration of the spell, the binding is clean, making it appear as if the objects were always a part of eachother. You can choose which parts or objects are bound together if applicable.

If you attempt to bind an object carried by an unwilling creature, that creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. Upon success, the spell fails and the creature knows that you attempted to cast a spell on its equipment. If the creature fails the check, it does not notice and the spell succeeds. Hostile creatures have advantage on these checks.
At 5th level, the mystical binding spreads between each adjacent object of the same material, to a maximum of a 5 foot cube area.

Creatures wearing boots or gloves bound to the floor, walls, etc are considered rooted, and cannot use the stuck limb for the duration. However, any bound equipped item can be removed and unequipped with an action, or a successful Strength check can break the item free, although this often destroys the item (at the DM's discretion.)

spell.name: Clandestine Conversation
entries: You touch up to two target creatures. The chosen creatures can converse with each other without anyone overhearing what they are saying.
Creatures who can read lips might still be able to determine what is said, but no Perception check can possibly allow one to overhear the conversation.

While under the effect of this spell, a target creature can speak to someone not affected by this spell, but everyone can hear that conversation normally. Only when one target creature speaks to the other target creature does the conversation remain private.

spell.name: Clothe/Unclothe
entries: When you cast this spell, choose one of the two following effects:

- Clothe: With a gesture, you cause any combination of bedding, draperies, unworn loose clothing, or tapestries to clothe the target, forming an improvised suit of armor equivalent to padded armor. When you remove the armor, it collapses back into its constituent parts, if any.

- Unclothe: With a gesture, you cause worn, loose clothing up to padded armor to unnaturally but harmlessly remove itself from the target and fly into a chosen spot within range, folding themselves neatly in the process.
With either casting of this spell you may choose which articles of cloth or other materials to include or exclude from the spell's effects.
If the target is unwilling to be clothed by this spell, a successful Dexterity save negates it, as the objects simply fly past the target before harmlessly falling to the floor.
If the target is unwilling to be unclothed by this spell, a successful Wisdom save negates it, as the worn objects rustle slightly before settling back again, harmlessly.
Should a target succeed either save, they cannot be effected by this spell again for 10 minutes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell can more adeptly clothe or unclothe the target at higher levels: it can don or remove hide and leather objects and armor at 5th level, chain and ring objects and armor at 11th level, and plate, splint, and mithril objects and armor at 17th level.

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Discerning Eye
entries: Reveals the exact local monetary value of a touched item or a touched container of items.

spell.name: Enter Mindscape
entries: By shutting down your normal senses, you extend your mind into the psionic landscape around you.

For the duration, you can use a bonus action to sense the presence of creatures within a 60-foot cone. You learn the number of creatures within the cone and their creature type. You cannot detect undead or constructs with this spell.
This spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead,or 3 feet of wood or dirt.
This spell's duration cannot be ended due to damage.

spell.name: Froot's Fruit Summons
entries: You create a single, whole fruit of your choice on the ground or in a container within range. The fruit is reduced in size to fit in your palm, but it can enlarge to full size at will, though it cannot return to its tiny size at will.

spell.name: Giggle
entries: You cause a target creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target suddenly finds something humorous enough to start giggling, and the laughter lasts for one full round.
While the target can still move and attack normally, he is unable to speak, or use bardic abilities or cast spells that rely on verbalization, until he stops giggling.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Guide Vessel
entries: A cart, wagon, boat, or ship moves as you command.
The vehicle can be no larger than 10 feet long + 2 feet long per level (a 10th-level sorcerer can steer a 30 foot long vessel). The craft must have its normal means of locomotion.

You do not need to concentrate to maintain this effect, so you could cast it on a horse-drawn wagon, command it to “go straight,” and take your eyes off the road. The horse will pull the wagon straight until you tell it otherwise or the spell’s duration ends. For the duration, you may also reprogram the Guided Vessel by touching it and giving it a new instruction to follow.
The spell does not imbue a craft (or the animals pulling it) with intelligence, but it does animate the craft to obey simple instructions, such as "Follow the road."

spell.name: Animate Tools
entries: The spell causes a tool — or a group of tools used together to perform a task — to animate and perform a task you designate. These tools follow your directions to the best of their abilities, but can only be used for their intended purpose. This spell allows you to complete an amount of work equivalent to a single person working for eight hours.

The tools use your Craft or Profession check as appropriate. The tools may aid another. There are many other common uses of this spell that require no check, such as commanding a broom to sweep the floor or a shovel to dig a trench.

Only mundane tasks can be accomplished with this spell. It has no effect on crafting magic items. Under no circumstance can tools be used to attack a creature, though items can damage a structure if that is their intended purpose (such as a pick or an axe).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Hydrate/Dehydrate
entries: Choose one:

- Hydrate: You cause up to 5 cubic feet of non-living or mindless material to become hydrated. This can cause small plants or leaves to perk up or restore dehydrated food to its original state of hydration, etcetera.
- Dehydrate: You cause up to 5 cubic feet of non-living or mindless material to become dehydrated. This can cause small plants or leaves to wilt or dehydrate food for later consumption, etcetera.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, the affected area expands by 5 cubic feet for each slot above 0th.

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level.

spell.name: Idyllic Sleep
entries: You touch one willing creature.

The target can get a good night’s sleep even in horrible conditions. Even wearing armor, lying on a slimy dungeon floor surrounded by corpses, a character can sleep soundly and only awakens when the spell ends or is dismissed. Creatures put to sleep in this way do not feel pain while asleep.
If a creature is attacked or loses hit points while sleeping, they are aware of who and/or what is attacking them or causing them to lose hit points, and can choose to awaken or remain asleep.

components.m: Fine sand, rose or cherry petals, or a live cricket

spell.name: Know Direction
entries: When you cast this spell, you instantly know the direction of north from your current position if north exists in your current environment. You also know the direction of the closest source of fresh water, the closest shelter, and the closest source of food.

spell.name: Larloch's Minor Drain
entries: You drain life energy from a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. You then gain temporary hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt until the spell ends.
This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level.

spell.name: Lesser Invisibility
entries: A creature you touch becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends, however, anything the target is wearing or carrying is not {@condition invisible}. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

components.m: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 0th.

spell.name: Lesser Quasiplane
entries: You create a tiny shadowy portal on a flat solid surface that you can see within range. The portal is large enough to allow Tiny creatures to pass through unhindered.

When opened, the portal leads to a {@spell demiplane} that appears to be an empty box 1 foot in each dimension, made of wood or stone. When the spell ends, the door disappears, and any creatures or objects inside the {@spell demiplane} remain trapped there, as the door also disappears from the other side.
Each time you cast this spell, you can create a new {@spell demiplane}, or have the shadowy door connect to a {@spell demiplane} you created with a previous casting of this or its related spells.

Additionally, if you know the nature and contents of a {@spell demiplane} created by a casting of this or its related spells by another creature, you can have the shadowy door connect to its {@spell demiplane} instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, the {@spell demiplane}'s size increases by 1 cubic foot for each slot above 0th.

spell.name: Lesser Water Breathing
entries: This spell grants a willing creature you touch the abilily to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures lose their normal mode of respiration for the duration.
The spell's effects can be dismissed with an action by said affected creatures.

components.m: A short reed or piece of straw

spell.name: Lullaby
entries: Any creature within the area that fails a Wisdom save becomes drowsy and inattentive, taking a -5 penalty on Perception checks and a -2 penalty on saves against sleep effects while the lullaby is in effect.
Lullaby lasts for as long as the caster concentrates, plus up to 1 round per caster level thereafter.

spell.name: Mind Fist
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range and project a focused beam of telekinetic power at it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Mind Strike
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range, and a psychic bolt pierces its mind. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Minor Telekinesis
entries: You stretch out your hand toward an object and thereafter lift it and move it at will from a distance. You can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction, though the spell ends if the distance between you and the object ever exceeds the spell’s range, and the object cannot weigh more than 5 pounds.
If a creature is holding or wearing the object which you intend to move, the spell fails, unless this object is only loosely upon their person, such as a hat or unfastened helmet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell can lift more weight when you reach higher levels: 10 lbs at 3rd level, 15 lbs at 5th level, 20 lbs at 7th level, 25 lbs at 9th level, 30 lbs at 11th level, 35 lbs at 13th level, 40 lbs at 15th level, 45 lbs at 17th level, and 50 lbs at 19th level.

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Muffle
entries: You silence the ambient noises produced by the target's movements, nullifying any stealth disadvantage caused by armor or other such sound sources and granting them advantage on stealth checks.
Perception checks based on hearing fail for creatures attempting to listen for the target's movements.
The target's voice is unaffected.

spell.name: Organize
entries: This spell automatically places a book, scroll, clothes, or other small object where it belongs within the confines of a library, drawer, etc. This spell will work even if the library or area does not have a shelving system, as the spell will determine the proper place based on the will of the owner.

Once the spell is cast, the caster needs only gesture at the object they want organized and the spell will place it there. The object is moved telekinetically, not via teleportation, so closed doors and the like will block the spell from functioning.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Pants
entries: You cause a single target to make a Wisdom saving throw (same DC as the spell). If failed, the target’s pants fall down to their ankles. Belts or suspenders offer no protection to the target, but armor that fully encompasses the legs, such as full plate, prevents the negative effects of this spell.

After having their pants fall, the target can refasten or remove their pants as a move action. If the subject does not pull up or remove their pants, movement is reduced by half, and if they attempt to move more than five feet in a single round, they must make a Dex save (same DC as the spell) or fall {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Preservation
entries: You cause all non-living material in a 5 foot cube to be mystically preserved against decay, rot, rust, spoilage, and wear for a single day.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you preserve the affected food, materials, or objects for an additional day for each slot above 0th.

spell.name: Psychic Step
entries: You alter the composition of your body in a subtle manner, allowing you to take seemingly impossible steps.
Until the end of your turn, you speed increases by 10 feet and you can walk across vertical surfaces without falling. If you end your turn on such a surface, you immediately fall.

spell.name: Quill
entries: This spell conjures a perfectly formed quill pen. The conjured quill has a soft glow. The quill does not need ink; it creates its own as needed. The quill vanishes if it leaves the caster’s hand.

spell.name: Rest
entries: You cause yourself to instantaneously fall into a deep, healing slumber.

You fall {@condition unconscious}. While {@condition unconscious} in this way, you regain hit points equal to the spell's level plus five times your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1) at the end of each turn, but cannot be awoken by any means for {@dice 1d4 + 2} turns. When you awake, you receive the benefits of a long rest.

components.m: A pinch of fine sand or flower petals

spell.name: Transcribe
entries: This spell copies a conversation, drawing, or writing onto the material component of the spell, and does so unnaturally quickly. A clay tablet, single page, or piece of scroll can hold up to one minute of conversation.
If the caster runs out of material components before the spell ends, the spell ends immediately.

components.m: paper, parchment, a tablet, or some other writing surface

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Unrelenting Force
entries: You shout and from your voice, a wave of force issues forth in a line before you. All creatures and unequipped non-magical objects in the path of this wave of force must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (whichever they prefer) or be pushed back 10 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and take {@damage 1d4} force damage. On a successful save, these are not knocked {@condition prone} and are only pushed back 5 feet and take half damage.
This spell can be cast as a bonus action, but doing so only causes the {@damage 1d4} damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Absorb Knowledge
entries: You lay your hand on a scroll, book, or other surface with writing on it and begin to absorb the message thereon into your mind directly, learning whatever the text had to offer. For every 10 pages, the duration increases by 1 second. (Example: A 600 page text would take 1 minute to fully learn its contents.)
While concentrating on this spell, you are considered {@condition blinded} as images of the absorbed knowledge race through your mind.
If the writing is in a language which you do not understand, the spell fails.

spell.name: Bound Creation
entries: You pull wisps of shadow material from the Shadowfell to create a spectral weapon or equipment of burning shadow.
Choose a non-magical object. The created shadow object matches the stats of the chosen real counterpart except that it counts as a magical weapon for the purposes of overcoming resistances.
If the chosen object is a bow, the spell also conjures 100 arrows and a quiver composed of the same burning shadow material.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 1st, and conjured weapons deal an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Invasive Thoughts
entries: You create a telepathic link with one creature you can see within 30 feet of you.
Until the link ends, you can telepathically speak to the target through the link, and if it understands at least one language, it can speak telepathically to you.

The link lasts for the duration, and it ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or die, or if you use another bonus action to break the link or to establish this link with a different creature.

spell.name: Lesser Reconstitution
entries: By laying your hand upon a summoned creature or construct, you cause its wounds to close and its form to solidify. This spell heals {@dice 1d10} points of damage +1 point per caster level (to a maximum of +5).

spell.name: Minor Wonder
entries: By a simple wave of the hand, you manifest a minor wonder.

When you cast this spell, choose any one utility (non-damage/non-healing) cantrip. This spell resolves as a copy of that cantrip except that it can have any number of its effects active at once, and you can create any number or combination of its effects for the duration of this spell within a 15 foot radius, activating up to 4 new effects each turn.
Minor Wonder does not utilize the chosen cantrip's range.
All non-instantaneous effects of the chosen cantrip with a duration of less than a minute have their duration changed to 1 minute, and can be dismissed as a free action.

spell.name: Summon Monster
entries: This spell summons an extraplanar creature. It appears where you designate and acts immediately, on your turn. It attacks your opponents to the best of its ability. If you can communicate with the creature, you can direct it not to attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions.

The spell conjures {@dice 1d4} of a single non-undead CR 1 (or lower) beast, dragon, elemental, non-PHB humanoid, or monstrosity. You choose which kind of creature to summon, and you can choose a different one each time you cast the spell.
A summoned monster cannot summon or otherwise conjure another creature, and creatures cannot be summoned into an environment that cannot support them.

When you use a summoning spell to summon a creature with an alignment or elemental subtype, it is a spell of that type. Creatures without subtypes can be summoned with the celestial template if you are good, the fey template if you are neutral good, neutral evil, or chaotic, and the fiendish template if you are evil.

If you are neutral, you may choose which template to apply to the creature. Creatures without an alignment of good or evil always have an alignment that matches yours, regardless of their usual alignment. Summoning these creatures makes the summoning spell’s type match your alignment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the CR of the summoned creatures increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st, and you may subtract 1 from the maximum CR in order to add {@dice 1d4} summoned creatures.

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Summon Nature's Ally
entries: This spell summons to your side a natural creature. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts immediately, on your turn. It attacks your opponents to the best of its ability. If you can communicate with the creature, you can direct it not to attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions as you command.
A summoned monster cannot summon or otherwise conjure another creature, and creatures cannot be summoned into an environment that cannot support them.

The spell conjures {@dice 1d4} of a single non-undead CR 1 (or lower) beast, elemental, fey, or giant. You choose which kind of creature to summon, and you can change that choice each time you cast the spell. All the creatures on the table are neutral unless otherwise noted.

When you use a summoning spell to summon a creature with an alignment or elemental subtype, it is a spell of that type. All creatures summoned with this spell without alignment subtypes have an alignment that matches yours, regardless of their usual alignment. Summoning these creatures makes the summoning spell’s type match your alignment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the CR of the summoned creatures increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st, and you may subtract 1 from the maximum CR in order to add {@dice 1d4 + 1} summoned creatures.

Additionally, the spell reaches further at higher levels: 30 feet at 3rd level, 35 feet at 5th level, 40 feet at 7th level, 45 feet at 9th level, 50 feet at 11th level, 55 feet at 13th level, 60 feet at 15th level, 65 feet at 17th level, and 70 feet at 19th level

spell.name: Taste of Blood
entries: You touch one creature with blood that has lost one or more hit points and cause its blood to be pulled from its wounds and absorbed by you as life energy.
Make a melee spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and you gain an equal number of temporary hit points which last until you finish a long rest.

spell.name: Unspeakable Tongue
entries: You force a touched target to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they speak unintelligible gibberish for the duration.

Among other effects, spellcasters under the effect of unspeakable tongue can still cast spells with verbal components, and can speak magic item command words, but cannot use language-dependent skill checks (such as Diplomacy) which become effectively impossible to make.
This effect can be dispelled or negated by a {@spell remove curse} spell.

spell.name: Breath of Life
entries: Touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the creature can use its action to exhale life energy in a 15 foot cone, which appears as an aurora of light-teal with dancing streaks of light. Each creature of your choice within the cone regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Permanence
entries: You cause a single active spell's (or spell like ability's) effects to have their duration changed to "Until dispelled."

spell.name: Scripts
entries: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand all written languages for the duration.
This spell does not grant the ability to understand ciphered scripts in those languages.

components.m: a small clay model of a ziggurat

spell.name: Blood of the Martyr
entries: You take upon yourself the wounds of others to spare them further harm.
For the duration, if damage would be dealt to any creature within 60 feet of you, you may have that damage be dealt to you instead.
Damage taken in this way does not affect your concentration.

spell.name: Traitorous Blood
entries: You point towards a creature and utter a subtle incantation which seizes the creature's mind with traitorous inclinations.

You cause a creature in range to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you for the duration and hostile to its companions and must use its next actions to attack its nearest ally to the best of its ability.

Until the spell ends, the target’s speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
When the spell ends, the target can’t move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it, and the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

spell.name: Riot Emotions
entries: You attempt to aggravate strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target hostile about creatures of your choice that it is indifferent toward. This hostility ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes indifferent again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

spell.name: Puppet
entries: Your gesture forces one humanoid you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target must move up to its speed in a direction you choose. In addition, you can cause the target to drop whatever it is holding and/or make a single weapon attack against a creature of your choice within range.
Dead or {@condition unconscious} creatures automatically fail their saving throw. This spell has no effect on a humanoid that is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Find Familiar
entries: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes the form of a Beast of CR 1/8 or lower. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.
{@note Additional {@filter animal form choices|bestiary|Miscellaneous=Familiar} may be available at the DM's discretion., and are most often of a CR of 1/8 or lower.}

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.
When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

m.text: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

spell.name: Boiling Blood
entries: Choose a creature with blood that you can see within range. You cause the targeted creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's blood begins to boil within them, causing them to take {@damage 2d8} fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause the creature to make the same saving throw again. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and the spell ends.
Creatures dealt damage in this way have disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame
